title: Senior Sales Consultant (ESG, SaaS)
description:
Join the Sustainability Revolution in New York!
Are you a high-performing sales professional with a passion for driving positive change and investments? Do you thrive in dynamic environments where innovation and cutting-edge technology intersect? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!
About Us:We are a trailblazing company at the forefront of the Sustainability and ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) space, leveraging the latest advancements in AI technology to revolutionize how banks, asset managers, and large enterprises approach ESG initiatives. Our suite of highly advanced ESG SaaS products is designed to empower clients within the buy-side space, providing actionable insights and solutions to drive sustainable growth and impact.
Position Overview:We are seeking a driven and experienced sales professional to join our team in New York. As a key member of our sales team, you will play a pivotal role in expanding our client base and driving revenue growth. Your primary focus will be on selling our innovative ESG SaaS solutions to banks, asset managers, and large enterprises, showcasing the value and impact of our products in driving ESG integration and sustainability initiatives.
Key Responsibilities:Develop and execute strategic sales plans to achieve revenue targets and expand market share within the buy-side space.Cultivate and nurture relationships with key decision-makers at banks, asset managers, and large enterprises, effectively positioning our products as essential tools for driving ESG performance and sustainability.Conduct thorough needs assessments and solution demonstrations to articulate the value proposition of our products and address client challenges and objectives.Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including product development and marketing, to ensure alignment of sales efforts with product capabilities and market needs.Stay abreast of industry trends, market developments, and competitor activity, leveraging insights to inform sales strategies and drive competitive differentiation.
Requirements:Proven track record of success in sales, with a minimum of 5years of experience selling highly advanced ESG SaaS solutions to banks, asset managers, and large enterprises.Deep understanding of the ESG landscape and familiarity with sustainability frameworks, regulations, and industry standards.Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex concepts and solutions to diverse audiences.Demonstrated ability to build and maintain relationships with senior-level executives and decision-makers.Self-motivated, results-driven, and adaptable, with a passion for driving positive change and making an impact.
Why Join Us:At our company, you'll have the opportunity to be part of a dynamic team that is shaping the future of sustainability and ESG. We offer competitive compensation, including a base salary and uncapped commission, comprehensive benefits, and ample opportunities for professional growth and development. Join us in driving meaningful change and making a difference in the world.
Ready to Make Your Mark?If you're a high-performing sales professional with a passion for sustainability and ESG, we want to hear from you! Take the next step in your career and join us in transforming the way businesses approach sustainability. Apply now and be part of our journey towards a more sustainable future!

title: Controller
company_name: Morgan Consulting Resources, Inc. - Healthcare Executive Search
description:
Morgan Consulting Resources is an executive search firm focusing on the Healthcare Industry for over 28 years. We have been retained by Curative Inc. to conduct a national search for the Controller in Austin, TX. This is an exceptional opportunity to be part of a well-funded growth stage health insurance plan bringing a differentiated product with no copays and no deductibles to the large group commercial space.
About Curative: 
Curative is a leading health care services company that has created and launched a first-of-its-kind large group commercial health insurance plan. Founded by CEO Fred Turner in 2020, Curative is reengineering health insurance by providing unmatched simplicity and cost transparency. As long as Curative members complete a Baseline visit within the first 120 days of enrollment, they will have no copays and no deductibles on in-network care for the whole year. The Baseline visit combines a health plan onboarding and education with a preventative health visit. Previously, Curative and its managed medical entities were national leaders in COVID-19 testing and vaccine-administration, delivering 36 million COVID-19 tests and over 2 million vaccines across more than 40 states.
Curative is dedicated to building a healthier tomorrow, together, with the belief that everyone should be able to get the care they need, when they need it. Curative’s leadership is focused on building high-touch preventive health care by offering a health plan with transparent pricing so members can engage earlier with preventative health and avoid significant downstream costs.
To learn more about Curative, visit: https://curative.com/
About the Position:
Reporting to the President & CFO, the Controller will oversee all aspects of the accounting department for the entire organization including insurance statutory accounting and reporting, closed door pharmacies, Third Party Administrator organization, Free Standing ER entity, and various other entities and will work to improve and establish the necessary processes for the department to run efficiently and accurately. This is an opportunity to grow your skillset and career in a fast growing organization. You will be responsible for leading and developing a team of high performing individuals looking for opportunities to learn and career growth. The Controller will be a motivational leader of an initial team of approximately 18 people and will ensure the appropriate infrastructure is in place to successfully grow and meet the needs of the members.
We are looking for an experienced leader with a solid knowledge of accounting processes and principles. The successful candidate will be highly organized and thrive in a fast-paced environment. The Controller must have strong organizational, project management, and problem-solving skills, with a continuous improvement mindset.
Select Responsibilities: Oversee administration and troubleshooting of the accounting system (NetSuite) and add-ons to ensure optimal uptime and proper training of staff on the system to maximize efficiencyBuild a strong accounting team by determining the right structure for the department and hiring and training the right talentEnsure appropriate foundation is built for growth including systems, policies and procedures and operating manuals and trainingEnsure all technical accounting issues are addressed and documented throughout the year – coordinate with outside auditorsEnsure accurate preparation of consolidating financial statements including appropriate intercompany entries and agreements, general ledger, and accurate initial coding of entries at the transactional and general ledger levelSeek areas to improve efficiency by improving workflow, setting up automation, or better using the accounting system to increase accuracy and efficiencyEnsure rapid close process and reconciliation of accounts at month end through work being done throughout the month and accurate entries to prevent reworkBuild internal control system based on the model audit rule/SOXServe as a liaison with other departments to ensure a timely flow of information and policies and procedures for improved information flows and protection of assetsOversee RBC calculations and IBNR and other insurance-related reserves and reinsurance matters, working closely with the risk management teamOversee various financial statutory filings including quarterly and annual statutory reports and medical loss ratio annual filing with CMS
Qualifications & Experience: Mix of public and private accounting experience; minimum of six years of supervisory experience, Big Four highly preferredDegree in accounting or other business related fieldHealth insurance experience is preferredEnjoys learning and complex environmentsPrior ERP system implementation or administrator experience preferredStrong organizational, project management and problem-solving skillsAbility to meet deadlinesAdaptability and desire to learn new areasCPA license required

title: Postdoctoral Researcher- Pierson Neurogenetics Laboratory
description:
JOB DESCRIPTIONJoin Tyler Mark Pierson, MD-PhD and his research group as a Postdoctoral Scientist in the Cedars-Sinai Regenerative Medicine Institute! Interest or experience in IPSC culture/Cerebral Organoids, molecular neurodevelopment, and/or chromatin function a plus!
The Pierson Laboratory is devoted to understanding the pathological mechanisms involved in pediatric neurogenetic disorders. The research goal of the Pierson laboratory is to model neurogenetic disease with patient-derived induced pluripotent stem cells in order to understand the disease mechanisms associated with pediatric neurodevelopment and neurodegenerative disorders. Exploration of stem cell-based therapies for the delivery of therapeutic drugs, small molecules and proteins is another focus of our work. The Pierson Lab is also involved in confirming diagnoses in children with known, but rare, neurogenetic disorders through cellular modeling, as well as developing research to link unique neurological presentations with new genes and causes. To learn more, please visit Pierson Research Lab | Cedars-Sinai.
Are you ready to be a part of breakthrough research?Tyler Mark Pierson, MD, PhD, has extensive experience studying neurogenetic disease using patient-derived IPSCs, molecular biology, and animal models. Tyler Pierson did his doctoral training at Baylor College of Medicine (advisor: Bert O'Malley, MD) and pediatric neurology training at CHOP/University of Pennsylvania, followed by a clinical fellowship in the Neurogenetics Branch of NINDS at the National Institutes of Health (NIH). Dr. Pierson was a member of the Undiagnosed Diseases Program at the NIH. In addition to directing his laboratory, Dr. Pierson is also the director of the Pediatric Neurogenetics Clinic of Cedars-Sinai and the pediatric lead of the Cedars-Sinai Center for the Undiagnosed Patient.
The Postdoctoral Scientist should have an interest in the basic science of induced pluripotent stem cells (IPSC), neurogenetic disorders, drug screening, and gene therapy. Interest in gene regulation, corticogenesis and lysosomal disorders are an added plus. The Postdoc works independently but in close cooperation and in consultation with Dr. Pierson and other Research Scientists. The Research Postdoc will be expected to develop, adapt, and implement new research techniques and protocols for these projects, as well as analyze and interpret data.
Primary Job Duties and Responsibilities:May assist in the preparation of grant proposals, but is not responsible for generating grant funds.May participate in publications and presentations as author or co-author.Designs and performs experiments. Will keep appropriate experimental records and documentation and analyze the results with the Principal Investigator.May develop, adapt, and implement new research techniques and protocols.Analyzes interpret, summarizes, and compiles data.Performs routine and complex laboratory procedures throughout the training period.Operates and maintains equipment and instruments.May observe MD-patient or MD-human research subject interactions as it pertains directly to research being performed.

QUALIFICATIONSEducation:Doctorate (MD, PhD, VMD, or DDS) in area directly related to field of research specialization.
Experience and Skills:Acquires technical and theoretical knowledge of research projects and objectives during one to five (1-5) year post-doctoral appointments.Works independently on research projects designed by a mentor (typically the PI) within the area of specialization.Demonstrated abilities and skills to perform experimental protocols and procedures, including detailed data collection, and analysis and operation and maintenance of specialized equipment.Scheduling flexibility including evening, weekend and holiday rotation commitment may be necessary. Travel may be required.Function efficiently and cooperatively with a team of faculty, research associates, technicians, and students.Excellent written and oral communication skills are essential.

ABOUT USCedars-Sinai is a leader in providing high-quality healthcare encompassing primary care, specialized medicine and research. Since 1902, Cedars-Sinai has evolved to meet the needs of one of the most diverse regions in the nation, setting standards in quality and innovative patient care, research, teaching and community service. Today, Cedars- Sinai is known for its national leadership in transforming healthcare for the benefit of patients. Cedars-Sinai impacts the future of healthcare by developing new approaches to treatment and educating tomorrow's health professionals. Additionally, Cedars-Sinai demonstrates a commitment to the community through programs that improve the health of its most vulnerable residents.
ABOUT THE TEAMCedars-Sinai is one of the largest nonprofit academic medical centers in the U.S., with 886 licensed beds, 2,100 physicians, 2,800 nurses and thousands of other healthcare professionals and staff. Choose this if you want to work in a fast-paced environment that offers the highest level of care to people in the Los Angeles that need our care the most.
Apply at https://jobs.cshs.org/#en/sites/CX_2001/job/1816

What will you be doing?

Provides frequent program level reporting to internal leadership team and the customer through program dashboards.

 Within a program, every project is different, and every stakeholder is unique. The skill of communicating both verbally and in writing to manage all these variables takes a very high level of awareness, emotional intelligence, and people management skills. title: Mission Crew Interfaces Test Engineer II
description:
At Blue Origin, we envision millions of people living and working in space for the benefit of Earth. We’re working to develop reusable, safe, and low-cost space vehicles and systems within a culture of safety, collaboration, and inclusion. Join our diverse team of problem solvers as we add new chapters to the history of spaceflight! 

At Blue Origin, we envision millions of people living and working in space for the benefit of Earth. We’re working to develop reusable, safe, and low-cost space vehicles and systems within a culture of safety, collaboration, and inclusion. Join our diverse team of problem solvers as we add new chapters to the history of spaceflight! 

This role is part of the Lunar Transportation business unit. To further Blue Origin's mission of having millions of people living and working in space, we are building the sustainable infrastructure for our transport of crew and cargo from Earth to the Lunar Surface.

Blue Origin is committed to building a future where millions of people live and work in space to benefit Earth. We must return to the Moon permanently, and the Blue Moon Lander enables this goal. Blue Moon is a large, flexible, reusable commercial lander for cargo or crew.

Our Lunar Transportation team is developing our lunar landers to demonstrate core capabilities – including the BE-7 landing engine, precision landing sensors, and advanced integrated power and propulsion architecture. The team building this vehicle is rethinking how space systems are designed, with a high-performing architecture, efficient reusability, and rapid design iteration. Come join our team and pave the road to a permanent lunar presence.

We are looking for someone to apply their technical expertise, leadership skills, and commitment to quality to positively impact safe human spaceflight. Passion for our mission and vision is required!

Responsibilities Include But Not Limited To

Develop test fixtures and equipment to support component and subassembly functional and environmental testingDevelop, plan and execute component and subsystem tests, including development, leak, shock, vibe, thermal, proof, and EMC.Develop test requirements, plans and procedures to ensure acceptable hardware/ system performance.Design, define, procure, and install system test components and materials; manage vendors and subcontractors during installation.Assist in evaluating hardware and system performance data from qualification and acceptance testing.Assist in troubleshooting qualification and acceptance test anomalies, provide dispositions for hardware non-conformances with supporting rationale, perform system and component risk assessments and define risk burndown in support of vehicle testing and ultimately flight.Identify opportunities for safety improvements and cost savingsDemonstrate high standards in test operations and work cooperatively with a diverse team of Integration Engineers, Responsible Engineers and BLUE customers to ensure requirements are metIntegrate between Mission Crew Interfaces subsystem and overall system level vehicle to ensure component level testing is in compliance with overall vehicle test plans.Lead daily test operations, operate test consoles, direct technician work and coordinate with internal customers.

Minimum Qualifications

Passion for our mission: Millions of people living and working in space!Minimum of a B.S. degree in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or similar2 years relevant test experience or 2 years relevant hands on systems engineering experienceExcellent written and verbal communication skillsAbility to earn trust, maintain positive and professional relationships, and contribute to a culture of inclusionMust be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

Preferred Qualifications

Integration and test experience with human space rated hardwareFunctional test experience with avionics, flight decks, cameras, and/or audio systems

Inclusivity Statement

Don’t meet all desired requirements? Studies have shown that some people are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single desired qualification. At Blue Origin, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every desired qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Export Control Regulations

Applicants for employment at Blue Origin must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e. current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

Benefits

Benefits include: Medical, dental, vision, basic and supplemental life insurance, paid parental leave, short and long-term disability, 401(k) with a company match of up to 5%, and an Education Support Program.

Paid Time Off: Up to four (4) weeks per year based on weekly scheduled hours, and up to 14 company-paid holidays.

Discretionary bonus: Bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results.

title: Senior Originator, Healthcare Asset-Based Lending
description:
Company Overview
Our client is at the forefront of the Asset Based Lending industry, offering financing solutions ranging from $10M to $100 million across the United States and Canada. With a solid reputation as a trusted partner, they specialize in providing senior secured solutions to privately held middle-market companies, publicly traded industry leaders, and financial sponsors, including private equity firms.
Since its establishment in 2012, our client has consistently showcased the ability to offer borrowers maximum flexibility and liquidity, even in complex situations. Their deep lending experience and expertise empower their clients to overcome challenges and realize their long-term visions. They pride themselves on bringing patience, perspective, and innovative approaches to every opportunity.
Job Description
The Director/Managing Director Candidate (the Candidate) is responsible for facilitating growth initiatives for the Healthcare Asset Based Lending group through consistent business development efforts and management of key client and referral source relationships throughout the United States. The Candidate is recognized as a major advocate for client initiatives and effectively leads deal teams and partners with other areas of the firm in achieving this mission successfully.
Your responsibilities will include:Identifying investment opportunities and leading deal teams in the origination and underwriting of these transactions, including diligence, credit memo preparation and investment committee presentationThe role is accountable for ensuring the team maintains the required internal control standards, including adherence to audit, regulatory and compliance policiesCoordinate analysis with research analysts to provide industry and market comp context for each transactionProviding deal structuring and additional expertise as knowledge base and needs dictate and negotiating transactions with clients on highly complex legal mattersMaintains key ongoing contacts across industries, referral sources and with sector relationship managersAligning tasks and assignments with departmental goals and objectives through leadership, planning and direction to the teamsEffectively influences and gains support of other areas of the firm in delivering solutions to clientsBuilding a high performance/ high productivity work environment by maintaining effective managerial practicesManaging and utilizing resources effectively to grow business and manage riskEffectively communicates and partners with othersStaying abreast of industry updates, communicates them as appropriate to leaders and staff, and applies changes as it meets with the strategic initiatives of the business unitEnsuring delivery of exemplary client service by troubleshooting as client advocate in a professional, ethical, and conscientious mannerOverseeing mandate and term sheet legal documentation subsequent high-level monitoring of underwriting process and legal documentationParticipating in preparation and discussion of concise, well-reasoned credit correspondenceProtecting the firms assets and maintain quality of the portfolio by adhering to lending processes, policies and procedures, legal and ethical requirements and regulations, audit requirements, and established risk guidelinesEnsuring that systems, reporting, and other controls are sufficiently robust to ensure that applicable policies and guidelines are met and that risk is appropriately mitigated
To thrive in this role, you will need:The Candidate will have a strong record of revenue generation from self-generated sales along with extensive experience structuring Healthcare asset-based loans, equipment financing, or factoring to fit borrower's needs ranging from sole lending transactions to highly complex multi-debt stack capital structuresExceptional abilities in business development with demonstrated excellence in sustaining significant revenue generationHighly developed written and oral communication skillsExceptional analytical skillsExperience generating ABL legal term sheets and negotiating ABL credit agreementsStrong interpersonal skills used within a team environment and in client interaction with emphasis on excelling in relationship-buildingKnowledgeable of risks to be capable of assisting in obtaining credit concurrence and coordinating pricing approval as client advocateProficiency in ABL Loan Agreements and related legal documentation.High-level proficiency with Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.Familiarity with various ABL Loan Systems.Willingness and ability to travel as necessary.

title: Enterprise Account Manager
description:
BigMarker is looking for a highly-organized and strategic Enterprise Account Manager with a background in client management, sales and/or software implementation. 
The ideal candidate has a successful track-record implementing software-based solutions and building positive relationships with customers. We are looking for a strategic and dedicated individual who will fit with our collaborative culture. If you enjoy working with other professionals who believe in creating innovative solutions to problems, we encourage you to apply. We are a rapidly growing company, so there is significant growth opportunity for high performers.
Founded in 2010, BigMarker was a pioneer of interactive video on the web. Today, we’ve evolved into a category leader in the webinar, virtual and hybrid events space, hosting over 5 million online events per year for over 5,000 companies and organizations globally, including more than half of the Fortune 500. Our HQ is in downtown Chicago.  ResponsibilitiesBuild positive relationships with customers: increase successful adoption and satisfactionWork with customers to establish their goals and key performance indicators, then aid customers in achieving their goals by devising account plans, long-term goals and strategiesManaging the design, build, launch, and post launch support for registration microsites, event mobile apps, virtual event platforms, on-site check-in and badging experiences, digital interactive audience engagement experiences, digital sponsor activation, and digital exhibitor lead retrievalDemonstrate commitment to customers through the highest level of responsiveness and thought partnershipUnderstand our product and service offerings, use cases, and value propositions to match customer needsLead with innovation by identifying new ways we can delight our customers and add to our product roadmapServe as an advocate for customer needs and issues, relaying the voice of the customer company-wideWork cross-functionally to ensure the needs and goals of your customers are sufficiently met, and provide regular updates to customers around product developments and roadmap additionsConduct business reviews on a regular basis to ensure client needs, goals, and key performance indicators are being metKeep up to date and accurate records of pipeline activityMaintain existing revenue and increases revenue in new lines of business on current accountsWhen presented with obstacles, offer creative, effective, and well-thought-out solutions

QualificationsMinimum of 5 years relevant work experience (ideally at a SaaS company in Customer Success or Account Management)Excellent client-facing and communication skills Experience with renewing and upselling existing client poolFamiliarity with collaboration and time management toolsSelf-motivated, efficient and able to prioritize time and resourcesFamiliarity with client management software for tracking sales and managing book of businessAdvanced time management and analytical skillsComfortable collaborating with product, marketing, and development teams to optimize product and customer experience
Diversity StatementBigMarker values diversity of culture and background for the benefit of our team, our product, and our world. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. This position is open to applicants who are legally authorized to work in the United States. We are not able to sponsor work visas at this time.
About BigMarkerBigMarker is a category-leading webinar, virtual and hybrid events platform, helping companies grow faster by hosting more meaningful conversations with their customers. Thousands of businesses, from startups to Fortune 500 companies, organizations, and universities use BigMarker to host highly customized live, on-demand, and automated virtual events, trainings and conferences. BigMarker also provides integrations, APIs, and white label services that enable companies to integrate powerful interactive video experiences into their marketing, sales, and learning stacks. We look for smart, driven, and creative team players who are ready to roll up their sleeves and deliver for our customers.

title: Mechanic C - Installation

The inventory technician is responsible for managing and maintaining the inventory of medical supplies, equipment, and other materials necessary for the efficient operation of healthcare facilities.
We're actively hiring and looking to have new employees begin working in the early weeks of May.

RESPONSIBILITIESMaintain accurate and organized records of all healthcare inventory including medical supplies, equipment, and materials.This includes tracking stock levels, conducting regular counts, and ensuring appropriate levels of supplies are on hand.Receive deliveries of medical supplies, equipment, and materials.Verify the accuracy of shipments, check for damages, and distribute items to the appropriate departments or storage areas.Monitor inventory levels and reorder supplies as needed to prevent shortages.Ensure that stock is rotated, and older items are used before newer ones to prevent expiration.Inspect incoming supplies and equipment for defects or damage.Remove and report any items that do not meet quality standards.Keep track of expiration dates and ensure expired items are properly disposed of.Maintain detailed and up-to-date inventory records using inventory management software and databases.Generate reports, requisition forms, and other documentation as needed.Assist in the preparation and maintenance of emergency supply kits to ensure the facility is well-prepared for disasters or unexpected events.
QUALIFICATIONSHigh school diploma or equivalent is preferred for this position. Additional coursework in supply chain management or a related field would be beneficial.Some experience in inventory management, preferably in a healthcare setting, is preferred but not required.Must be highly detail-oriented to maintain accurate inventory records and ensure the quality of supplies and equipment.Effective verbal and written communication skills are important for interacting with colleagues, vendors, and other healthcare staff.Strong organizational skills are essential to keep inventory storage areas orderly and efficient.

title: Mechanisms Design Engineer Sr - Lunar Permanence
description:
At Blue Origin, we envision millions of people living and working in space for the benefit of Earth. We’re working to develop reusable, safe, and low-cost space vehicles and systems within a culture of safety, collaboration, and inclusion. Join our diverse team of problem solvers as we add new chapters to the history of spaceflight! 

We are a diverse team of collaborators, doers, and problem-solvers who are relentlessly committed to a culture of safety. This position will directly impact the history of space exploration and will require your commitment and detailed attention towards safe and repeatable space flight. Join us in lowering the cost of access to space and enabling Blue Origin’s vision of millions of people living and working in space to benefit Earth.

This role is part of the Lunar Permanence business unit. To further Blue Origin's mission of having millions of people living and working in space, we are building the sustainable infrastructure for our transport of crew and cargo from Earth to the Lunar Surface.

As part of a hardworking team of diverse engineers, you will be responsible for the design and analysis of spacecraft mechanisms and delivery of safe, reliable, ready to install hardware that meets requirements, while doing so within the allocated cost and schedule requirements.

Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To

Design mechanisms for space flight which may include landing gear, engine gimbaling mechanisms, docking systems, solar and radiator deployment systems, communication gimbals, hatches, and cargo offloading systems. Participate in the entire design cycle of flight hardware, including conceptual and detailed design, trade studies, structural analysis, development testing, and qualification. Generate component drawings, assembly drawings, and interface control documents with application of GD&T per ASME Y14.5. Create documentation for assembly and testing of development and flight hardware. Participate in subsystem level testing including planning, execution, data reduction and analysis. Develop component specifications and manage suppliers. Leverage experience and engineering judgement to quickly design and produce non-flight, proof of concept hardware for fast-moving research and development projects Participate in a small, agile team to create and adapt to frequently shifting priorities. 

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor of Science Degree in Engineering Level 4 Requirement: 8+ years of experienceRecent experience designing aerospace or equivalent type mechanical system elements within aircraft, spacecraft, or launch vehicles Strong mechanical design, integration, and mechanism analysis skills using 3D modeling and simulation tools (CREO preferred). Experience with GD&T analysis (ASME Y14.5) and performing tolerance stacks Knowledge of manufacturing, assembly, integration, and qualification testing Proficient in technical writing, communicating sophisticated ideas clearly and concisely Experience specifying and justifying margins and test sequences for aerospace systems Ability to earn trust, maintain positive and professional relationships, and contribute to a culture of inclusion Must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

Preferred Qualifications

Master of Science Degree in EngineeringExperience with Matlab/SimulinkExperience with multibody simulation tools (Simscape, Adams)Experience writing technical specifications and Statements of Work (SOW)Experience with technical management of suppliers.

title: Electrical Design Engineer, Instrumentation II
description:
At Blue Origin, we envision millions of people living and working in space for the benefit of Earth. We’re working to develop reusable, safe, and low-cost space vehicles and systems within a culture of safety, collaboration, and inclusion. Join our diverse team of problem solvers as we add new chapters to the history of spaceflight! 

We are a diverse team of collaborators, doers, and problem-solvers who are relentlessly committed to a culture of safety. This position will directly impact the history of space exploration and will require your commitment and detailed attention towards safe and repeatable space flight. Join us in lowering the cost of access to space and enabling Blue Origin’s vision of millions of people living and working in space to benefit Earth.

This role is part of the Blue Origin Engines business unit, where our focus is the design and implementation of electronic control systems. Specifically, engine controller electronics and associated instrumentation sensors and actuators. This particular position targets engines powering human occupied vehicles.

Built for multiple uses, our family of engines is powering the next generation of rockets for commercial, civil, national security and human spaceflight.

We are looking for someone to apply their technical expertise, leadership skills, and commitment to quality to positively impact safe human spaceflight. Passion for our mission and vision is required!

Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To

Support and become expert at the methodologies and circuits that implement precision electronic instrumentation measurements as used in rocket engine controllers. Work with power conversion circuits that drive electrical actuators (such as solenoids, servo-valves, etc.).Resolve engine controller electrical issues. This requires proficiency utilizing lab equipment.Document design issues discovered during controller qualification activities. Process and document non-conforming development issues.Assist functional testing and inspections of electronic assemblies at contract manufacturing (CM) sites.

Minimum Qualifications

BS EE or related field (possibly Computer Engineering, Physics)2+ years’ experience performing electrical design of precision instrumentation measurement circuits.Knowledge of power conversion electronics as applied to servos and actuators.Expertise in digital electronics, especially embedded processor configurations.Proficiency in popular Electronic CAD packages (schematic entry, simulation)Hands-on lab debug skills. Proficient utilizing lab equipment and making measurementsExcellent communication skills, written and verbalAbility to earn trust, maintain positive and professional relationships, and contribute to a culture of inclusionMust be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

Preferred Qualifications

MS EEExperience with Aerospace electronic developmentFamiliarity with DO-254 standards related to flight hardware.Circuit board layout experience

title: SEO Content Manager
description:
About the role:
This is your chance.
To break away from the mind-numbing confines of SEO content marketing, where you’re constantly regurgitating the top 3 results instead of creating new frameworks to illustrate concepts.
To make good on your dream of becoming an editorial master and teacher whose channel happens to be SEO… and winning awards for your most creative work.
To work at a creative agency where the clients hire you as a thought partner to grow their online reach and brand affinity by producing the most thorough, well-researched, and creative informational content on the web.
Don’t miss this chance.
North Star Inbound is seeking an SEO Content Manager (or a Content Marketer; we just have to play along with LinkedIn’s unimaginative algorithm) to produce the most dynamic search-driven content on the web. Daily, you will be brainstorming, researching, analyzing, writing, and art-directing content that millions of people will consume.We want someone who’s an exceptional writer and has a remarkable ability to learn a wide variety of topics quickly and deeply. You’ll need to be as comfortable understanding the finer points of maneuvering a telehandler as you are about the differences between sisterlocks and microlocs.
You must be endlessly curious with a penchant for persistence.
This is a dynamic role that requires strong time management skills and extraordinary attention to detail (see: your content will be read by millions of people).
Are you a senior editor tired of marking up reams of boring text? Are you a curious writer but tired of the limitations of your industry? Are you a content manager, content strategist, or any other stripe of editorial professional who just happens to be looking for the coolest job in SEO? Well, you’ve found it.
Responsibilities:Conduct keyword research to inform client strategyIdeate creative content ideas based on research of industry trends, keywords, competitor analysis, and trending topics.Produce comprehensive, well-sourced, and creative content briefs with minimal supervision.Oversee and own the production of well-written and creative blog content with minimal supervision.Create and maintain a client content calendar while working with other team members to meet all client deadlinesOptimize blog content for ranking highly in the SERPsIncorporate brand voice and style to speak to the client’s target audienceMentor other team membersResponsible for client reporting and account management
Required Skills:3+ years of experience producing content for the webAdvanced understanding of keyword research and other on-page concepts.Impeccable understanding of search intent and how to leverage it to create content that beats the competitionExceptional research skills–fluency in researching materials outside of Google to bring new information to our client content.Precise understanding of citation and sourcing practices, including when and how to use primary and secondary sources.Comfortable speaking to executives about content strategy, performance, and resultsExcellent written communication skills, including grammar and editing skillsExcellent attention to detailStrong project management skills with proven ability to manage and prioritize competing timelinesFast and independent learner who picks up new topics quickly and thoroughlyAbility to collaborate with multiple stakeholders and implement feedback across projects
Preferred Skills or What You May Learn:1+ years working in an agency environmentExperience working in a remote teamUnderstanding of successful outreach campaigns with bloggers and journalistsExperience with Google Analytics, Google Data Studio, Ahrefs, SEMRUSH, and other popular SEO tools and an ability to use them to inform client strategy
Salary: $65,000 - $75,000, depending on skills and experience
Benefits we provide:Health benefits Paid holidaysPTOBonuses for client referralsUltimate flexibility as we are a fully remote office.
About North Star Inbound:North Star Inbound is an award-winning content marketing agency. We’ve delivered 7-figure search gains for our clients with our content and digital PR strategies. Our tools are best-in-class content and outreach campaigns. Our campaigns outperform because we put the most compelling content in front of the right audiences, even in the most competitive niches. Our work is seen by millions and has been featured in The Atlantic, The New York Times, The Independent, NBCNews, Forbes, The Washington Post, Fortune, Inc., NPR, CNBC, Newsweek, and The Los Angeles Times, among others. Our clients range from ambitious startups to beloved brands. We are a woman, LGBTQIA, and Latinx-owned company that believes diversity makes us better at what we do. We strongly encourage people who identify as members of minority groups to apply.
This is a remote position.North Star Inbound is an equal-opportunity employer.

title: Audio-Visual Installation Technician
description:
At Diversified, we don't just follow tech trends - we set them by leveraging the best in technology and ongoing advisory services to transform businesses. Our comprehensive suite of solutions is engineered to help our clients build connections that make a difference – whether by inspiring viewers, engaging associates, motivating audiences, or streamlining and safeguarding operations.

Our dedicated teams craft solutions experienced by millions every day including:

Delivering the fan experience at one of 100+ sports facilities for the NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, MLS, NCAABuilding the first fly pack broadcast system transportable by air - bringing the 2022 World Cup and Super Bowl into homes across the worldEngineering the first high-density pixel canvas to display HD content at that scale for the Vornado, Marriott Marquis LED Display in Times Square, NYEmpowering and monitoring communication and collaboration solutions within multi-national companies around the globe

Founded in 1993, we’re a global organization serving local needs with associates worldwide. Learn more at onediversified.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter .

What part will you play?

The installation technician is responsible for performing a wide variety of installation duties on technology projects for our clients. This position is the key field position for the bulk of the actual work that gets done in our client’s buildings. The install tech needs to coordinate with project management, field superintendents and others to fully understand their role on specific projects. They interpret our drawing packages to create the basis of the finished systems. This installation can include displays, projectors, loudspeakers, microphones, equipment racks, etc. Will also provide advice and guidance to Associate Installation Technicians as necessary.

What will you be doing?

 Possess all skills from Associate Install Technician and most skills from the Associate Fabrication Technician job descriptions to install components and make modifications on site as necessary to complete the project  Physical installation of a wide variety of technology into a wide variety of locations  Execute a wide variety of cabling terminations for all wire and connector types and ability to test completed terminations  Support the preparation of equipment racks for staging of equipment wire lacing including installation of power strips, grounding bars, jack-fields, etc.  Able to read and understand functional design drawings as well as cable riser diagrams and all architectural drawings  Able to assist in the mounting of base build equipment such as monitor mounts, ceiling speakers’ microphones and projectors  Provide a consistent level of technical performance as well as flexibility in work schedule. This position requires periodic overtime and may require regular overtime for extended periods to meet fabrication deadlines  Able to complete assignments in accordance with or better than established task durations as well as estimate task durations to meet assigned deadlines. Provides daily feedback to Project Manager, or Site Superintendent  Able to build and wire custom designs from engineering drawings  Fiber optic cable handling, installation termination and testing  Can print and make minor corrections to cable labels  Maintain an organized work environment specifically orderliness and cleanliness of the shop and jobsites.  Responsible for maintaining their toolkit, company vehicles and installation materials inventories. Keeping things clean, orderly and well documented  Responsible for maintaining their personal licenses, certifications and qualifications. (Some states have specific requirement in this area)  Maintain daily record of time worked on specific projects for timesheet entry and work performed reports 

Complexity

This level of technician will be responsible for performing tasks on client’s job sites with little supervision. On smaller projects this position may be responsible for the coordination with clients, contractors and subcontractors.

Decision Making Authority

This position is often alone on the job sites and requires making good judgement about decisions that need to be made. In general, the project manager and a site supervisor are available to answer questions. This position requires good diplomacy in working with our clients and other key stakeholders on the job sites.

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that may be met by an employee. The employee may be exposed to construction site conditions on a regular basis. Employee will be responsible for their safety while on job sites and to comply with all safety regulations in place by the GC. Use of PPE is usually required on job sites. The employee can typically spend at least 60% of their time on their feet and be required to mobile around the construction site. The employee must have the ability to occasionally climb ladders, use stairs and lift and/or move materials up to 40 pounds in construction areas. The individual is regularly required to use keyboards, test equipment and controls required for SI installation projects. Specific vision abilities required for this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision and depth vision. When not on construction sites, the employee will experience normal office conditions and be required to use office equipment such as computers, peripherals, etc.

Travel

Frequent travel by car and occasional airplane trips are required. Employee must possess a valid driver’s license in their state of residence. Local travel to job sites (within a 2-hour driving distance each way) will make up 70-90% usually but remote travel can be up to 30% of the job at times. 10% remote travel is required on a regular basis.

Safety

 Maintain and wear appropriate PPE as the job and tasks require it.  Ensure hazards are addressed and rectified in a timely manner. 

What do we require from you?

Education/Certifications

 High school or GED equal  AVIXA CTS Certification is desired  3-5 years as an associate technician and/or fabrication technician or related industry experience  Must have a valid driver’s license and adhere to our insurance requirements  OSHA 30 Certificate is highly desired.  Other relevant certifications may be required or preferred based on the technology focus of the position 

Required/Desired Knowledge, Experience And Skills

 Familiarity with a wide range of audio, video and networking equipment  Knowledgeable of low voltage electrical concepts  Possess basic carpentry and/or installation skills  Proficient use and safety with power tools  Good verbal communication skills and good customer service skills  Ability to diagnose, troubleshoot and resolve technical problems 

To learn more about becoming part of the Diversified team, visit us at http://diversifiedus.com/about/careers/ or email us at careers@onediversified.com.

Diversified is an equal employment opportunity employer and all aspects of employment will be based on job requirements, individual qualifications, merit, performance and business needs. We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, age, disability or genetic information, or any other applicable characteristic protected under federal, state or local law. We celebrate diversity and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply for available positions. Individuals needing assistance or an accommodation to complete an application due to a disability, may contact Human Resources at  careers@onediversified.com .

Apply Now

title: Tax and Compliance Accountant
company_name: American Printing House for the Blind
description: Reporting to the Senior Director of Finance, the Tax and Compliance Accountant is responsible for preparing tax payments, returns, and registrations for the organization. Additionally, this role will be responsible for supporting the overall tax compliance function of the organization and special projects as assigned. This position requires a solid foundation in accounting principles and tax rules and regulations, as well as excellent analytical skills, and the ability to work independently as well as within a team.Prepare the necessary paperwork for tax payments and returns. Complete quarterly and annual tax reports. Recommend tax strategies that align with business goals.Provide periodic reports to senior management and board committees on industry trends, state of the compliance programs, and the status of key initiatives. Share financial data with the Finance team and management.Work closely with Internal Audit to evaluate and implement internal controls and best practices. Properly document all internal controls and evaluate effectiveness.Liaise with internal and external auditors. Coordinate outsourced tax preparation work. Prepare and process Form 1099s for vendors.Work cohesively with Internal Audit to identify potential areas of compliance vulnerability and risk across the organization, making improvement recommendations where needed.Work cohesively with Internal Audit to manage, develop, and improve compliance training, ensuring dissemination of training and monitor compliance of training requirements. Contribute to the development and improvement of audit and accounting processes and procedures to enhance efficiency and accuracy.Research local/state tax rate changes related to Payroll. Complete state 501c state registrations for new hires. Monitor and respond to tax authority communications.Research/create state, local, SUTA, and School District Tax rate changes and update within the payroll system. Maintain compliance with state TPA submissions by working closely with Payroll for submittal to Paycom.Submit POAs to newly created state tax accounts as well as other required documentation. Partner with Operations, Systems Administration, etc. to ensure continual improvement of compliance monitoring systems, processes, and oversight. Comply with annual and charitable reporting requirements.Assist in administration of registration and compliance processes with numerous state, county, and local jurisdictions.Other duties as assigned.

title: Staff Engineer
description:
Minimum Requirements:Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering or another related engineering degree (Mechanical, Environmental, Chemical, etc)Valid driver’s license with acceptable violation history.
Requirement Plusses:1-3 years’ of civil engineering or other relevant experienceConstruction or engineering work/internship experienceDOT work experience (MDOT, KDOT)Engineer-in-Training (EIT) or Engineering Intern (EI) highly preferredMaster’s degree in engineering preferred.

Summary: Insight Global is seeking an entry level Staff Engineer that will provide engineering and consulting services for a broad array of projects and clients. This may include performing and/or leading field investigations, engineering analysis, calculations, and recommendations, design and development of plans and specifications, observation and inspection, and the writing, preparation, and review of related reports for the services provided. Review drawings and construction to assure compliance with plans and specifications. Prepare proposals and cost estimates, track and evaluate project progress, budgets, and recommend changes. Research and resolve design and construction problems. Assign, review, and evaluate laboratory or field data for inclusion in reports. Apply sound engineering principles and be able to communicate complex engineering issues and concepts to technical and non-technical clients and project teams. Services may be provided for existing or proposed projects in the public works, transportation, commercial, communications, energy, and/or industrial sectors.  Essential Roles and Responsibilities:
First 6 months will be hands-on training20% of work in the field consulting on active construction sites Review of technician reportsFollow safety rules, guidelines and standards for all projects. Participate in pre-task planning. Report any safety issues or concerns to management.Maintain quality standards on all projects.Proficient engineering professional responsible for managing and executing small projects of minimal complexity.Assist in developing the scope of work for routine projects.Assist in the preparation of cost estimates, specifications, and other project related documents.Analyze data, and perform engineering calculations and analysis for PE review.Conduct, coordinate or supervise field investigations, laboratory testing, and evaluation of respective data.Develop plans, schedules, conducts, and/or coordinates detailed phases of assigned project work.Work closely with senior-level project manager and Professional Engineer of Record to gain project management and engineering experience.Makes design recommendations, adaptations and modifications for review and consideration by the Professional Engineer of Record.Prepares work scope, proposals and reports and plans investigations for approval by senior level professionals. May supervise field staff including graduate/field engineers, engineering technicians, exploration teams, laboratory staff and other support personnel.Interacts with client and project team in developing scope of services and communicating project progress.Works under the supervision of a Professional Engineer.

title: New Shepard Ground Systems Software Integration
description:
At Blue Origin, we envision millions of people living and working in space for the benefit of Earth. We’re working to develop reusable, safe, and low-cost space vehicles and systems within a culture of safety, collaboration, and inclusion. Join our diverse team of problem solvers as we add new chapters to the history of spaceflight! 

This role is a part of New Shepard, a reusable suborbital rocket system designed to take astronauts and research payloads past the Kármán line, the internationally recognized boundary of space. Through operational reusability, New Shepard supports our mission of lowering the cost of access to space.

Description

As part of a small, passionate, and accomplished team of experts, you will be the first line of support developing integrated technical solutions with the next generation of ground software capabilities. A significant part of this role will be developing the interplay definition of the software products that will operate for the next generation of New Shepard to enable a scalable, maintainable, and high cadence ground system. The New Shepard Ground System Software Integrator will be responsible for coordinating all technical aspects of software including network, IGS, ICE, EGSE/RF, and ground autonomy aspects working together with the New Shepard Software team. The job will be based in Kent with routine travel to the launch site in Texas. Additional responsibilities may be assigned depending on individual experience and qualifications. This position will directly impact the history of space exploration and will require your dedicated commitment to and detailed attention towards safe and repeatable human spaceflight.

Responsibilities

Ensure integrated software system behaviors and properties meet program objectivesDefine and document software and system interfacesEnsure separate development projects will technically integrate when phased over timeDevelop approaches for integrating, validating, and verifying ground software developed under individual projectsStrategize technical solutions which encompasses both Hardware and Software as a system by engaging the software and hardware teamsWork with the software and configuration management teams to streamline re-occurring software change and configuration management processes.Coordinate with flight control software and system engineers to plan, develop, and lead system verification and qualification, to ensure that mission systems products meet system requirements and safety-critical standards.Development of rapid prototypes for conceptual and technical demonstrationsCoordinate timing and content of software and network updates for flight and ground systems in cooperation with vehicle/ground managers and system operators.Lead and participate in software and network change review and scope definition discussions to evaluate operational impacts.Own and maintain software-specific operation procedures and user interfaces.Provide direct front-line software and network technical support as needed.Work with engineering teams to resolve critical software or network anomalies and discrepancies.Provide operational feedback on software performance to the engineering teams as part of post-flight reviews.

Qualifications

Minimum of a B.S. degree in engineering or equivalent experience.Strong coordination and project management skills. Must be able to track, manage and prioritize multiple simultaneous tasks and jobs.10+ years of experience managing, writing, and testing software, preferably in an operational environment.Familiarity with python and C++ and/or PLC coding and industrial control system software and/or TCP/IP networking concepts.A proven track record of working successfully with multiple disciplines, and the ability to evaluate technical recommendations from subject matter experts in a wide range of disciplines.Willing and available to travel to our Launch Site 1 as needed to support development initiatives and flight or maintenance operations.Must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

Desired

Experience with engineering support of field operations.Experience developing real-time embedded C++ applications.Familiarity with Matlab/Simulink

Compensation range for on site WA applicants is $143,990-$201,585

Compensation range for on site CA applicants is $143,990-$201,585

title: Packaging Engineer II
description:
At Blue Origin, we envision millions of people living and working in space for the benefit of Earth. We’re working to develop reusable, safe, and low-cost space vehicles and systems within a culture of safety, collaboration, and inclusion. Join our diverse team of problem solvers as we add new chapters to the history of spaceflight! 

We are a diverse team of collaborators, doers, and problem-solvers who are relentlessly committed to a culture of safety. This position will directly impact the history of space exploration and will require your commitment and detailed attention towards safe and repeatable space flight. Join us in lowering the cost of access to space and enabling Blue Origin’s vision of millions of people living and working in space to benefit Earth.

As part of a small team you will develop protective packaging and handling requirements for protective packaging for aerospace parts and assemblies that will be shipped from the manufacturing site to suppliers for outside manufacturing processing and eventually on to the launch site. Includes development of shipping requirements for raw materials. This position will support all Transportation and Logistics functions to ensure on-time delivery of products.

We are looking for someone to apply their technical expertise, leadership skills, and commitment to quality to positively impact safe human spaceflight. Passion for our mission and vision is required!

Responsibilities

Oversee and manage packaging development process, including the creation of packaging standards, designs, prototype development, and performance testing, if needed.Interpret military and commercial standards and be capable of applying them to packaging designs.Analyze engineering drawings and specifications of product to determine physical characteristics of item, special handling, environmental and safety requirements, and types of materials required for packaging. Ensure packaging designs are optimized for manufacturability..Troubleshoot new and existing packaging problems involving designs, materials and processes and provide creative, timely, and cost-effective solutions.Interaction with both internal and external customers to meet demands to support Blue Origin production requirements.Work closely with suppliers, Engineering, Manufacturing, and Supplier Management. Observe and offer opportunities for improvements in corporate process.Support extensive travel throughout the US as required.

Qualifications

A bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering or packaging engineering is required. Must have 2+ years of experience in a Packaging Engineer functionYears of work experience can be substituted for degreeKnowledge and understanding of packaging design validation standards (ISO, ASTM, etc.), drafting and specification standardsExperience in 3D CAD software.Experience in Logistics, Transportation, and Shipping aerospace hardware (minimum 2 years)Experience with Shipping Department functions which include material handling, packaging aerospace hardware and hazardous materials, and raw materials including metals (minimum 2 years)Ability to earn trust, maintain positive and professional relationships, and contribute to a culture of inclusionMust be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

Desired

Experience in manufacturing, aerospace or military environments.Experience with all modes of transportation.Experience with International ShipmentsExperience with protective packaging materialDangerous Goods certification for all modes of Transportation or some knowledge of 49 CFR, IATA, or IMDG Code.Experience with interpretation of military packaging standards, specifically MIL-STD-2073-1.Understanding of physics and physical forces on products during transportation

title: Prototype Development Engineer III - JARVIS
description:
At Blue Origin, we envision millions of people living and working in space for the benefit of Earth. We’re working to develop reusable, safe, and low-cost space vehicles and systems within a culture of safety, collaboration, and inclusion. Join our diverse team of problem solvers as we add new chapters to the history of spaceflight! 

We are a diverse team of collaborators, doers, and problem-solvers who are relentlessly committed to a culture of safety. This position will directly impact the history of space exploration and will require your commitment and detailed attention towards safe and repeatable space flight. Join us in lowering the cost of access to space and enabling Blue Origin’s vision of millions of people living and working in space to benefit Earth.

Do you embrace rapid development and thrive in a startup environment? Come join the JARVIS team.

As a JARVIS Prototype Development Engineer, you will be part of a diverse and hardworking team of engineers and specialists. You will collaborate with internal customers to take concepts from ideation, execute the manufacturing and create functioning prototypes and engineering demonstration units.

JARVIS Engineers are expected to operate with a rapid iterative development mindset and leverage their engineering and manufacturing experience to enhance the capabilities if the team.

If you share our passions and vision, thrive in a dynamic startup environment, excel on integrated multi-functional teams of diverse individuals, are experienced and skilled in several relevant technologies (even if perhaps not in the aerospace industry), continuously seek out opportunities to learn and improve, and do not allow title or job description to limit the depth or breadth of your contributions, then we would love to hear from you.

We are looking for someone to apply their technical expertise, ability to lead, and dedication to quality

to positively impact safe human spaceflight. Passion for our mission and vision is required!

Responsibilities Will Include

Collaborate with stakeholders in designing systems by, developing concepts from ideation, executing thru manufacturing and integration, resulting in functional Engineering Development Units.Manufacturing, programming, and machining prototypes over several iterations in collaboration with stakeholdersHands-on contribution to manufacturing and development efforts as requiredImplementing new capabilities to support critical schedulesDevelop manufacturing work instructions to clearly define the manufacturability of a part.Closely manage the fabrication, quality, post processing, and schedule of hardware throughout the entire fabrication process.Perform engineering drawing review and provide final approval for manufacturing.Define and support repair and rework activities.Design tooling and fixturing for ease of manufacturing.

Qualifications

Bachelor of Science in Mechanical, Manufacturing, Industrial, Electrical, Chemical, or Aerospace Engineering6+ years in design any of the following systems: Environmental control and life support, Crew, Intravehicular (IVA), Extravehicular (EVA), Propulsion fluid systems, Thermal fluid systems, Test Stand design, Chemical/Process pilot plants, Reactor design, and similar projects6+ years in direct manufacturing and manufacturing engineering experience, including CNC programming and machining.Proficiency with CAD CREO and WindchillDemonstrated success in developing concepts thru ideation, executing fabrication and test; advancing concepts through TRLs.Thrive in a constantly evolving environment.Able to take on challenges with incomplete information and pivot to drive progress.Work well in a collaborative team environment.Eager to jump in and manufacture as the need arises.Consistent track record of manufacturing experience directly related to part machining.Understanding of engineering fundamentals for mechanical design and manufacturing including working knowledge of GD&T.Strong written, personal, technical, and software skills (CAD, Scheduling, Issue Tracking, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc).Ability to develop processes compliant to industry quality systems such as AS9100.Highly customer focused with strong verbal and written communication skills.A demonstrated ability to work cooperatively with teams of diverse skills across large geographic distances.Ability to earn trust, maintain positive and professional relationships, and contribute to a culture of inclusion.Must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.Experience in rapid iterative development

Support manufacturing and fabrication floor activities.Climb stairs and work in small areas.Lift and carry 40 lbs.
